entry.title: KMF 1.3.0
entry.content: After fixing issues and add severals features like the JS cross-compilation, we finally release our KMF version 1.3.0.

entry.title: Kevoree Watchdog 0.10
entry.content:
We just release the last version of watchdog. This release include severals fix but especially it add the support of LATEST and RELEASE keyword pour the Kevoree version.

Regards, Duke

entry.title: Kevoree Watchdog out
entry.content:
The Kevoree Watchdog project as been release under version 0.8. Avalaible under public maven repository, the watchdog allows better integration of Kevoree and OS services. Indeed, it is available as a simple Jar file for fine management but also as a standard debian .deb package for easier installation.

You can found all informatino about Kevoree Watchdog on the dedicated project github page.

entry.title: KMF BETA3
entry.content:
We release a KMF 1.3.0-BETA3 version. This maintenance release fix a bad dependency in one pom file.

Regards, Duke

entry.title: Kevoree Modeling Framework now synchronized with Maven Central Server
entry.content:
Hi all,

We just finish the synchronization of Kevoree Modeling Framework with the Maven Central Server. Now the link with Kevoree Maven repository is not necessary any more. So user can remove from their pom section like :

<pluginRepository> â€¦. </pluginRepository>

We also release the 1.3.0-BETA2 version of KMF, which is the first version synchronized with the maven repository.

For maintenance reasons, a tag on our repository will be created in the same manner.

Best regards, Duke ;–)

entry.title: KMF 1.3.0 BETA1 is out
entry.content:
We have release the first beta of Kevoree Modeling Framework : 1.3.0-BETA1. The final version is planned for delivery before the end of this month so please help to test it and send feedbacks and bugs through the github tracker.

This new version mainly stabilize the Kotlin generator and add the JSON format support. Last but not last we had some special keywords like “contained”. Details can be found in the documentation.

Best Regards, Duke :–)

entry.title: KMF 1.3.0 soon to be released !
entry.content:
KMF 1.3.0-SNAPSHOT is currently being intensively beta tested. Join the beta-testers team!

The official version will be released before the end of this month. It will include more robust, yet super efficient, serializers and loaders for XMI (Eclipse compatible), as well as for JSON (with a human-readable syntax).

The release of KMF 1.3.0 will in turn trigger the release of Kevoree 2.0, which Francois will tell you more about very soon :–)

Stay tuned!

Brice

entry.title: Blog migration
entry.content:
New Blog ! Due to the end of posterous service we switch to a new blog engine. Stay tuned and update your RSS reader !

Duke

entry.title: New Stickers ;-)
entry.content:
Dear Kollowers,

WE ARE NOT DEAD. At least, not yet.

We are still busy with lots of papers to write, implementations to experiment and thesis to defend, but still working ! As a proof of that, we just received a new goodie :-)

Thenew Kevoree stickers has arrived !!

They give you a first brief outlook on the future graphics of the next generation of Kevoree ;-)

Stay tuned ;-)

entry.title: Kevoree will drive a new node ...
entry.content:
Say Hello to Kevoree drone ;-) .

This work is done with JeD for local firefighters for emergency area monitoring.

The sensors are majors fonctionalities of our autonomics computing case studies, and for gas and temperature sensing, drones allow catching better than ever... of course there non only sensors in the story but also some embedded computer named RapsberryPI...

 

Stay tuned...

[[posterous-content:IkintsgrbuEneHDCplEg]]

entry.title: Maven server Scheduled Downtime !
entry.content:
Our hosting provider is physically moving some servers from one site to another..

Our server hosting the Maven repository will be moved tonight Thursday 18th, between 2am and 8am.

We will check as soon as the operation is completed that the Maven repository is properly serving the binaries you need.

Sorry for the disturbance,

The Kevoree Team

entry.title: Kevoree Tutorial #2 Video is available !!
entry.content:
Yes, The second tutorial video of Kevoree is now available.

This new tutorial shows the compilation chain, and the continuous design ability offered by Kevoree.

 

Have a great time ;-)

... and stay tuned !

entry.title: New Kevoree Tutorial video
entry.content:
Good afternoon,

A new tutorial video about how to use Kevoree to create a first simple Chat application has juste been released.

Pleas have a look at it :-)

This is the first video of a serie, we hope to find enough energy to complete the serie :-)

Stay tuned ;-)

entry.title: Kevoree 1.8.2 and Raspberry Pi board
entry.content:
Hello all,

I've just publish Kevoree 1.8.2 , it contains mainly severals bug fix, in Kevoree M@RShell export , Node bootstrap and many others.

Another great new, we just receive thanks to our friends and collegues from Norway some RaspberryPI board. First tests on kevoree runtime are very impressive. So we will provide a dedicated runtime to support dynamic adaptation on such devices.

Stay tuned …

 

 

[[posterous-content:kxoqrfwqhzwqFAclfEFs]]

We've just pusblish a 1.8.1 version to fix some incompatiblities of aether connectors with windows and to workaround no sha-1 file on remote repository.

Some minor naming bug are also fixed in this version

entry.title: 1.7.9 Version
entry.content:
Hello all,

We've juste publish Kevoree 1.7.9 version.

Severals bug improve the stability, especially for android runtime.

We also add severals cool feature in KevEditor like save model as KevScript or load from ArduinoNode.

entry.title: Kevoree 1.7.1 maintenance release
entry.content:
Hi , 

Kevoree 1.7.1 has been published. It is a minor maintenance release which fix some collisions usings Kevoree keywords in components.

Regards

entry.title: Kevoree 1.7.0
entry.content:
Finally the stable release is arrived with some minor revision about core components, core library and also a new tools framework allowing to use Apache Camel on Kevoree.

Enjoy and stay tuned ;-)

entry.title: Kevoree 1.7.0-RC1
entry.content:
Kevoree team is happy to announce the new Kevoree release candidate: version 1.7.0-RC1.

This new version contains a lot of bug fixes.

Final version will be release at the end of the next week.

Please feel free to test and report bugs on github  before this date.

entry.title: Kevoree life ...
entry.content:
Software engineering aims at building methods to ensure the robustness of software vis-à-vis its future developments ... If it is still difficult to imagine such problems when starting a new project, it is interesting to see what happens after a while ...

We have exported thanks to gource app a video that shows the evolution of our Git repository from a year ... You say refactoring ... ;-)

 

Kevoree 1.6 is in final stage . Stay tuned .

entry.title: Kevoree 1.6 is coming !!!
entry.content:
We are actively working for finalise the beta phase of Kevoree 1.6 .

Please feel free to test it and report bugs.

Current version is 1.6.0-BETA2

entry.title: Kevoree 1.5
entry.content:
Kevoree members are happy to announce the new Kevoree stable release 1.5.

First works about Kloud has been introduced on this release and more stuff will be available on the next release (1.5.1) during the next month

entry.title: Kevoree Cloud status
entry.content: Kevoree Cloud work in progress ... We just received new nodes ...[[posterous-content:BjsAssfDAAaekzfHAmga]]

entry.title: Kevoree Kloud work in progress !
entry.content: We prepare for some weeks now Kevoree version 1.5.0 which will be released soon (~ 20 december). This version will include a new framework for building Cloud computing architecture. We prepare an internal cloud demonstration, here are the first pictures of the installation of equipment.[[posterous-content:jinIBztsggcgGCBzAbbc]]

entry.title: Kevoree 1.4
entry.content: Kevoree team is happy to announce that Kevoree 1.4.x branch is now stable and is release under 1.4.1 version. Many work has been done have a new very light runtime with a new data structure. The groups API is also in this this release, several implementations are available, Rest, JmDNS, Serial , etc ... Stay tuned ! :-)

entry.title: Kevoree 1.4.0 BETA 1
entry.content: First beta of Kevoreee 1.4 is out. Many new features are included, separation between nodes and groups is cleaner. Kevoree Modeling Framework allows a significant gain in memory footprint. More to come ...

entry.title: New tutorial
entry.content:
A new getting started tutorial has been written by Jean Emile for Java SE platform. This step by step guide details how to write your first hello world component. 

https://github.com/dukeboard/kevoree/wiki/Getting-Started

entry.title: Kevoree 1.2.0 is out
entry.content: Kevoree 1.2.0 is out ! This stable version includes many bug fixes and supports Arduino nodes out-of-the-box ! The team now concentrates on the next 1.3 version wich will bring support for cloud infrastructures, Kinect device and node type extensions ... Stay tuned ;-) !

entry.title: Kevoree release candidate is out
entry.content: The first release candidate for Kevoree 1.2.0 is out. Please report your bug as quick as possible we are targeting a release for the 15 september 2011.

entry.title: New maven repository
entry.content: A new maven repository is available to reply to performance needs to serve Kevoree files ! You can use it seamlessly with the previous one just by changin adress maven.kevoree.org to maven2.kevoree.org.

entry.title: A brand new day
entry.content:
Today is a brand new day. At least for the Kevoree familly. Today, a new bread of technology is born. 

The Kevoree team is very please to anounce you the born of 

K-Strip

the Kevoree-powered power strip. 

[[posterous-content:gdeczwGetodBuEzgenHc]]

Features

  • A status led in the front to provide users with feedback
  • A Infrared receiver to control the K-Strip using a remote control
  • 4 managed power socket with 4 status led on the top, making it possible to activate/disactivate plugged devices remotely
  • A current sensor inside, to get informed of the overall energy consuption of the K-Strip
  • Temperature and Light sensors on the top
  • A buzzer
  • A standard ElectronicBrick connector on the side to allow future user specific extentions
  • A 433Mhz Transceiver to remotely control the K-Strip using radio frequency communications
  • Firmware customizable through a USB connection.

K-Strip applications are just limited by your imagination. 

Control up to 5 DMX-compatible products(DMX extention required), while playing a song on the buzzer.
Create a lightning sequence to control four light.
Control by any mean: being placed behind your entertainment devices (TV, DVD player, Sound system), switch on and off the connected devices using a generic remote control, a radio control command.

The revolution is on its way.

Box it, plug it, play it !

entry.title: K-Stuff prototypes, from the dream to reality
entry.content:
The official release announcement of the first K-Stuff prototype is sheduled for Monday May 16th at 09:00(Paris).

A source close to the leading team told that this release is the first of a future entire set of devices Kevoree#Ready. It seems that this first K-Stuff is moreover Kevoree#Inside.

To get informed about future posts:

  • get new posts directly in your mailbox by subscribing to the Kevoree Blog on the right side of this page

entry.title: K-Stuff creation in progress
entry.content:
Francois and I are currently creating "Kevoree ready" devices and connectors for already existing protocols.
In the pictures, you can see different steps in the creation of a DMX connector or a Kevoree-Inside power strip...
More to come :-)

entry.title: Kevoree Demo... with a nice picture
entry.content:
[[posterous-content:EtcxHcjrrEhpktEediac]]

Nice X-Mas tree! And I am not simply talking about the fake tree on the right-hand side ;-)

Detailed explanations in a future post.

entry.title: Training Course in progress
entry.content:
A Kevoree workshop is in progess today (April 22nd) from 2pm to 4pm at IRISA/INRIA Rennes.
Please feel free to contact us if you want to participate.

Apologize for the late advertisement.

entry.title: Kevoree 1.1.0-RC1 is out !
entry.content:
Kevoree 1.1.0-RC1 is out !
Many bugs have been fixed and the support of arduino nodes is now supported directly in the editor.

Added Features : GroupType & NodeType
Added Library : Gossiper group algorithm

entry.title: Kevoree impressed our MODERATES colleagues
entry.content: We had a MODERATES project meeting this Wednesday. As usual, we prepared very few slides and mostly relied on live demos... including a demo based on Kevoree, in our brand new show-room (formerly a crappy object-room). Our colleagues were quite impressed by this demo :-)

entry.title: EnTiMid on its way to Kevoree
entry.content:
EnTiMid have been designed to be a component based framework to ease both design and use of home automation solutions.
Proposed in several projects, presented in many public interventions, EnTiMid is soon to be released as a commercial product.

On its way to its industrial life, EnTiMid met Kevoree, and decided to work with.
At this time, all integrations we have done to make EnTiMid work using Kevoree brought promising good news, and new features.

entry.title: MODERATES uses Kevoree as an integration platform
entry.content:
MODERATES (SINTEF internal project on Model-Driven Engineering for the Internet of Things) uses Kevoree to wrap physical devices into software components, managed by Kevoree. Currenlty integrated: Waveman and ESIC devices (home automation), Arduino-based brick sensors (http://www.seeedstudio.com/depot/electronic-brick-starter-kit-p-506.html?cPath=138&zenid=6f3e2c4e4111c582b1edc80da9496998), and a mysterious device to spy the coffee machine...

More to come...

entry.title: JNLP fixed !
entry.content: A special thank you to Apache Felix developpement team wich has fixed the bug introduced by the update number 1.6.0_24  of java virtual machine. Use of OSGi in Java Web Start and Applet is now ok. As a result the last Kevoree (1.1.0-beta1) runtime can now be launched by the JNLP link.

entry.title: First Kevoree message !
entry.content: Blog is now open !
